name: Zenji Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Small and away form the tourist epicentre of Stone Town (a lovely 15 minute walk). Rooms are smaller than they appear on the website but still good value for money. Clean and a notch above your average 'back-packer' establishment.
reviews.title: So friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were super friendly and helpful. Prices for tours, guides etc are padded though.
reviews.title: feel at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: travelling around tanzania by your own is as amazing as difficult
reviews.title: We loved it - FANTASTIC place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most turistic places are amazing, asi it is stone town and all zanzibar, but also very primitive and hard to move around.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Reasonably Priced! A True Gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: and is not easy to find places like zenji hotel, where you can feel at home, have a nice delicated bedroom for a fair price, and internet connection everywhere, and be very well treated by all the local staff, both the owners and the employees.
reviews.title: Unique Hotel in Stone Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 6 nights here in total, 5 at the start of our holiday and 1 at the end. It was generally OK. I'm slightly mystified at all the great reviews here. There was nothing wrong with it, but it wasn’t anything remarkable and I certainly wouldn’t rush back.
reviews.title: It was OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Organised a few trips through them ie city tour etc.. Then realised that after speaking to the guide he was getting just one third of the cash I gave the hotel, so organised the rest direct with guide. I don’t mind a bit of mark-up, but it felt excessive.
reviews.title: Good place, great staff and breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: This place has a great personal feel to it. The location is good since it right near the ferry terminal and walkable to most parts of Stone Town. We stayed for 2 nights and felt the area to be pretty safe. I would call this more of a hostel (not a hotel) based on the very little room service we got. The staff were great though and the breakfast was amazing. I would definitely recommend this place if you are not expecting your usual hotel amenities like fancy building, swimming pool, great room service etc.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we felt ourselves welcome in this nice cosy hotel. The staf is very friendly. There is a nice rooftop area to relax and have breakfast. And very important: free and reliable wifi access.
reviews.title: Just GREAT! Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Great staff, very kind and helpful. Location OK, walking distance to main attractions and near the dock to take the ferry. Great breakfast! Excellent stay!!!
reviews.title: A lovely welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Zenji Hotel for three nights and absolutely loved it! Great location near the ferry terminal, just off an interesting & busy street.
reviews.title: We LOVED the Zenji Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Treasure Chamber had a nice balcony and the shared bathroom was no problem. The room was not only clean, but absolute luxury especially after two weeks on Safari and Kilimanjaro. We were especially thankful for the air conditioning.
reviews.title: Good for a stop off in Stone Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast on the rooftop patio was a great way to start off each day and their home-made jams are the best I've ever had. The staff is really, really friendly and helpful. We booked all of our tours with their help, including a Spice Tour, Sunset Cruise, and Walking Tour. The shop and coffee shop downstairs are a little expensive, but quite nice as well. Free wifi there, on the patio and in the rooms too!
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Located in a very good position - can walk to everywhere.
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff VERY friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, wonderful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I loved my stay at the Zenji Hotel! It is only a short walk to the ferry dock, the beach, the nighttime market, the museums, the day market. I found the rooms clean and lovely with intricately carved wooden beds with satin lined mosquito nets. There is air conditioning and really nice complimentary soap! There were cute little balconies to sit out on and read. My favorite place was the roof top cafe. The complimentary breakfast was amazing!!!! They had 5 kinds of bread (including chocolate), homemade vanilla pineapple and vanilla banana jam!!! Fresh fruit and juices as well as coffee and tea. I spent a lot of time up there just reading and drinking a tangawizi (a delicious kind of ginger ale). THe staff were incredibly helpful and friendly from the waitresses at the cafe to the cleaning staff to the front desk, they were all wonderful! The bathrooms were also clean and had lots of hot water, even the shared bathrooms and I never had to wait for the shared bathrooms either (I believe there is one on every floor so you only share with 1 other room)
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel for your island getaway vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Zenji hotel is a nice option if you want to sleep in Stonetown. The rooms are big, comfortable beds with mosquito net, and good bathrooms and air con. it's a good value compared to the other more expensive hotels in Stonetown.The breakfast is amazing, on the top floor, with homemade jams, fresh juices and fruits, toasted bread....The staff is nice but depending on who you ask you can get good information or a really over charging tourist trap (taxi for example)
reviews.title: good value in Stonetown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Zenji hotel is a great place to be - just to relax or to use it as a hopping point in to Stonetown old city or to the market. It is conveniently located near a Forex bureau and the ferry port and not too far from Freddy Mercury's bar or down town fort area. Good value for money and excellent welcome and service.
reviews.title: Great place four our school group

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in 5 different places over 2 weeks in Zanzibar, including some $300 per night places but the 1001 Arabian Nights room was the best actual bedroom we had! Nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Best room of our holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Zenji Hotel was phenomenal. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, and the rooms are nice. Breakfast features homemade breads and jams, and real coffee, which can be difficult to find in Zanzibar. Everyone was very genuine, and it is located near the central bus terminal, which is convenient. They have free wifi as well.
reviews.title: Superb everything!

description: Just opened, in the middle of bustling StoneTown, ZenjiHotel welcomes guests for a relaxing stay on the rooftop or in one of the 9 authentic rooms (all with fan and a.c., some with balcony). All rooms have a different atmosphere referring to the rich Zanzibar heritage and culture. The breakfast, including homemade bread and jams, fruit juice, fresh fruit, different types of tea and real espresso coffee, is served on the rooftop from which you have a beautiful view over Stone Town and the harbor.
